result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Henrietta Rogers

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 23 pages) commencing 09-26-2022 by Debra A. Wisniewski.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Henrietta Rogers in court.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court for Henrietta Rogers.  Attorney Matthew James Torbenson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Arraignment held.
Original Information received and filed. Defense counsel waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. 
Defense counsel advises Court they have not yet received discovery.
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28. 
State advises Court that there was an objection to defendant's out of custody status however that individual has not appeared in court on today's date therefore State is not prepared to request bail modification.

Clerk:  jms
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated September 30, 2022 - received

ADDRESS INFO for Henrietta Rogers
Current: 4247 North 70th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216 United States  (Effective: 09-29-2022)
Prior: 4724 North 44th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218

Defendant Henrietta Rogers appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont appeared by video for Henrietta Rogers.  Attorney Jade K Hall appeared by video for Henrietta Rogers.  Prosecuting Attorney Mallory Davis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective R. Bergemann. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading. Defense requests an arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.
Arraignment scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.I.C.

Court sets bail at $50,000 cash

Conditions of bail to include:
Turnover to JusticePoint for Supervision Level 5
Cooperate with Milwaukee County Behavioral Health and any programming recommended by them
No Contact Order with J.I.C.

Arguments to the Court as to bail
Court will set bail

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Henrietta Rogers in court, in custody.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont and Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Henrietta Rogers.  Attorney James Griffin, appearing for Matthew James Torbenson, in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Parties in court as to return of doctor's report.
Parties in receipt of examiner's report.
State is not challenging the findings of the doctor's report.  Defense counsel and defendant are not challenging the findings of the doctor's report.
There being no challenge to the report by the State, defense counsel or defendant Court adopts the professional opinion of the examiner's that the defendant does not lack substantial capacity to understand the proceedings or aid in her defense. 
Court finds defendant competent to proceed and orders the proceedings reinstated.  

Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

Clerk:  jms

Court is in receipt of doctor's report.
Deputy clerk in contact with the parties via electronic mail as to rescheduling the return of doctor's report hearing to an earlier date.
Parties have agreed upon a date.
Return of doctor's report hearing is rescheduled to September 19, 2022 in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
ROGERS Competency Report.  Received and Filed.  nk
Cover Sheet for Confidential Records.  Received and Filed. nk

Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) - updated

-  signed by the Court (electronically)
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Henrietta Rogers (appears via Zoom video) with Attorney Vincent Guimont (appears in person) and Attorney Jade K Hall (appears in person).  Defendant Henrietta Rogers in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson (appears in person) appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Also present, Dr. Amanda Vastag (appears via Zoom video) and Dr. Kristin Johnson (appears via Zoom video).

State is not challenging any of the doctor reports.
Atty. Guimont advises Court he attempted to review the doctor's report with the defendant but did not receive a reply whether the defendant agrees or disagrees with the findings of the doctor's report.
During the hearing, the Court attempted to engage the defendant and defendant declined to respond to the Court.
Court finds the defendant is standing moot; State advises Court they are unable to demonstrate otherwise.
Therefore the Court finds that the defendant is incompetent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within the statutory time frame.  

As to involuntary administration of medication:
Statements to the Court by Dr. Johnson
Sworn and testified for the State:  Dr. Amanda Vastag

On motion of the State, Court took judicial notice of the June 20, 2022 doctor's report with treatment plan.
Parties stipulate to Dr. Vastag's credentials.
State requests administration of medications.
Defense counsel requests additional time before the involuntary administration of medications.
For reasons stated on the record, Court found that the defendant is not competent to refuse medication for the mental condition. 
Court will sign order as to administration of medication.

Court orders case adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Henrietta Rogers not in court, in custody appearance waived.  Erin Michelle Karshen for Matthew Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for return on doctor's report.  Court reviews doctor's report with the parties.  State, defense counsel are not challenging the findings of the doctor's report.  The Dr A. Vastag filed a Motion for Court Order Medication/Treatment the court will address at the next court date.  The parties request a Competency hearing.   Court orders case adjourned  in Branch 28.

The Court ordered defendant remain committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care. 
 
Competency hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Motion on Medication Order received and filed
Medication Order Request Report Received and Filed.
Cover Sheet Received and Filed
Individualized treatment plan for Henrietta Rogers received and filed
Dr. Johnson report dated 6/13/2022, received and filed
cover letter for doctor's report, received and filed
Order for Commitment for Treatment, filed.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Henrietta Rogers not in court, in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Case in court for return on doctors report. Defendant refused to appear in court.  Parties review and do not contest  Doctors Report dated 03-08-2022.  Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame.   Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility.  Order of Commitment signed and filed.  Court orders case adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report in Branch 25.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
-filed.
-signed and filed.

Attorney Jade K Hall and Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Henrietta Rogers not in court, in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Return on Doctor's Report. Court is advised that the defendant is refusing to come to Court or to speak with defense counsel. Parties have reviewed the report filed by Dr. Jenna Goebel.   Court ordered an inpatient examination by the Department of Health Services FORTHWITH.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
-filed.
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE on next court date.

Defendant Henrietta Rogers in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Henrietta Rogers in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Henrietta Rogers appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Commissioner tolls the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
